intro: Argyrolobium aequinoctiale f. elongatum, commonly known as the elongated silver globular vetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its distinctive feature is the elongated, silver-green pods that develop after flowering. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
